{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3486197,"name":"","username":"mineable3","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mineable3/{size}/231504_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T00:08:32.253Z","cooked":"

My team mainly uses NEOs and the SparkMax motor controller for our robot. The spark max comes with a PID implementation that can be accessed through the SparkMaxConfig class. The WPILib library also has a PID Controller class. I am familiar with both and have used both in the past. Our robot has a telescoping arm that needs position control.

What are the differences between the two and which one should I use?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T00:08:32.253Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":411,"reads":254,"readers_count":253,"score":2105.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66516,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/1","custom_user_title":"Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3486282,"name":"Otto","username":"GreenTomato","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greentomato/{size}/214780_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T01:46:12.300Z","cooked":"

If you use the Spark Max PID implementation the PID Controller will run on the motor controller and will presumably be faster, If you use the wpilib one it will run on the RIO. You should be fine with using either (benefits of using the sparkmax PID will probably be marginal)

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T01:46:12.300Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":66.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"Otto","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59898,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3486288,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T01:54:32.004Z","cooked":"
GreenTomato:

(benefits of using the sparkmax PID will probably be marginal)

Not necessarily. Running PIDs on the motor controller means you get significantly less latency and a much faster sampling frequency, both of which help because latency is detrimental to feedback control of any form. Excessive latency destabilizes controllers, especially derivative gains, meaning that when running a PID on the motor controller, you can run more aggressive D gains, and as a result, more aggressive P gains.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T01:54:32.004Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":193.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3486787,"name":"Kyle Reeve","username":"kreeve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kreeve/{size}/187015_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T19:15:17.093Z","cooked":"

Less latency and way less jitter

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T21:52:00.481Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":164,"readers_count":163,"score":37.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50219,"username":"Alex_Y","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66516,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/5","custom_user_title":"Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3486981,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T22:00:56.862Z","cooked":"

Be aware that once you start the PID in the MC it keeps going. My team has been surprised by that and had forgotten that is must be turned off slightly differently than if the code is on the roboRIO.

How does one “turn off” the PID controller on the spark max? Wouldn’t it just stop when the robot is disabled?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T23:36:01.793Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66516,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/7","custom_user_title":"Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3487161,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-19T01:17:55.695Z","cooked":"

Yes, you can run a PID controller continuously until the robot is disabled which stops motors fairly quickly. A common mistake is setting a position controller to 0 (position) to stop it.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-19T01:17:55.695Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":54.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66516,"username":"mineable3","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mineable3/{size}/231504_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3487209,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-19T02:43:09.142Z","cooked":"

One thing that has not been mentioned yet is that the reason it was common to use WPILib PIDs with SparkMax in the past was due to the lack of true profiled motion control in RevLib. With MAXMotion replacing SmartMotion, there will be far less need to turn to WPILib profiled PID controllers.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-19T02:43:09.142Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":58.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/9","custom_user_title":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490731,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T16:01:16.408Z","cooked":"

Except the documentation for MAXMotion position control leaves something to be desired. And they really didn’t fix anything. No feedforward in the position control for max motion is their recommendation.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T16:01:16.408Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":34.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60512,"username":"four","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490757,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T16:40:09.229Z","cooked":"

They did fix some things. The loop is now actually closed on position, which is a very substantial improvement.

The suggestion to omit feedforward is perplexing, though. A well-tuned feedforward is only ever a good thing.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T16:40:09.229Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":77.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48345,"username":"narmstro","name":"Nicholas Armstrong","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/11","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490761,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T16:46:07.108Z","cooked":"

Also I’ve noticed that their documentation states the loop runs at 10 ms instead of 1ms. SysId uses a preset of 1ms for characterizing. I vaguely remember it being 1 ms in the past, but someone will have to check me up on that.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T16:46:07.108Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482378,"topic_slug":"spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-pid-controller-vs-wpilib-pid-controller/482378/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490790,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:12:21.188Z","cooked":"

So here is an intake implementation we were working on. I added position control (normally not needed, but wanted to SIM).

repo

I’m running the simPeriodic with a period 10 ms using addperiodic instead of 1 or even 20.

I am using max motion velocity for speed control and regular position for position control with a simple motor feed forward (using 20 ms) and a trap profile (using 10 ms. I know weird) in my apply methods. This results are pretty stable. I’m not sure why the trap needs to be 10 not 20. Its less stable at 20. My only guess is its tied to the sim period, but I’m running the apply’s as 20 ms with periodic.

Only the simulation Periodic is run at 10 ms. The trap profile is using a period of 10 ms for its math, run in a 20 ms loop.

If anyone can explain the trap period that would be great.

I’ve also added a snapshot of the sysId results. Ignore the scaling. I used dumb units and found the fix after running it. Unable to run it again I found I had overscaled by 2 pi.

sysId1591×940 190 KB

I suspect it might be because they haven’t integrated feed forward into the onboard algorithm yet, and at the moment you’d only be able to set a feed forward value at 50Hz.

necessarily. Running PIDs on the motor controller means you get significantly less latency and a much faster sampling frequency, both of which help because latency is detrimental to feedback control of any form. Excessive latency destabilizes controllers, especially derivative gains, meaning
